item.title: Introduction to Regression Discontinuity Design - Lessons from an Onboarding Project (1/2)
item.description:
This article lays the groundwork for understanding Regression Discontinuity Design (RDD), a robust causal inference method, by examining its core assumptions and setting the stage for a follow-up on conducting the analysis and interpreting the results.

Regression Discontinuity Design (RDD) has long been recognized as the identification strategy for precisely estimating treatment effects in non-experimental setups. When a project satisfies all the assumptions and requirements, RDD performs almost as well as a randomized control trial (RCT). However, unlike online RCTs, RDD often receives limited attention in the IT industry. For major social platforms and app-based products, running standardized, fast-paced, and stratified experiments on a subsample of users is relatively cheap1.
